basics.name: Tanishq Jasoria
basics.label: Senior Undergraduate, Department of Mathematics
basics.summary: I am an inquisitive and curious person and am always excited about exploring the unknown, and this is why I have delved into seemingly diverse fields. I have worked on various projects involving myself in secure software development, systems security, robotics, deep learning and embedded systems. I believe in the current world scenario, having specialization in one niche field is not as rewarding as developing an appreciation and understanding for a melange of various inter-twined skills.

awards.title: Kishore Vaigyanik Protsahan Yojana (KVPY) Fellow
awards.summary: Awarded a fellowship of INR 4.64 Lakhs ($6500).

awards.title: Campus Sustainability Challenge
awards.summary: Secured third position among 23 participating IITs at Inter-IIT Tech meet held at IIT Bombay.

awards.title: National Standard Examination(s) in Physics and Chemistry (NSEP and NSEC)
awards.summary: Finished in top 1% in the state of Rajasthan.

awards.title: Xilinx Innovation Challenge
awards.summary: Progressed to the finals, being one of the top 16 teams.

awards.title: IBM Blockchain Hackathon
awards.summary: Progressed to the finals, being one of the top 20 teams, nationwide.

work.company: NUS-Singtel R&D Lab, National University of Singapore
highlights: Developed a system to capture whole-system provenance using kernel audit data for the purpose of system audit.
Developing a system to detect an ongoing threat campaign using the whole-system provenance graph in real-time.
Developed a cross-platform analytics engine, for application usage monitoring, using the ELK stack.
Reduced data latency by 80% using WebSocket connections to fetch OHLCV data from exchanges.

work.company: Secure Systems Lab, New York University
highlights: Prevented rollback and hardware mismatch attacks on Uptane, in case of a compromised software repository.
Encrypted the updates, delivered using Uptane, by implementing hybrid end-to-end encryption (RSA2048 + AES128).
Added the support to externally sign a repository metadata in TUF using hardware security tokens (PIV/CCID).
Developed the control architecture based on Finite State Machines for coordinated control of RoboCup SSL robots.
Implemented RTOS (ChibiOS) for scheduling of various tasks performed by central control board (STM32F407).
Spearheaded a team of 50 students to win a Silver Medal in technical challenges round at RoboCup 2018.
work.position: Team Head, Embedded and Control Systems Team

highlights: Developed a robotic exoskeleton to impart locomotive ability to assist the people with neurological disorders.
Designed a wearable device to record the gait-cycle, with a latency of 1.2 seconds, using nRF and Raspberry Pi.
Implemented a control system for Switched Reluctance Motor(SRM), increasing the torque gain by 230%.
Designed and fabricated a hardware unit to read the angular position of a SRM using axial mount magnetic encoders.

volunteer.summary: Undertook the responsibility for the administration and management of finances amounting to over 10 lakhs ($14000)
